snippet: Municipal bond investors stole center stage in bond trading yesterday as they quickly bought up $1.6 billion of tax-exempt bonds backed by toll revenue from a Southern California highway.    In the largest tax-free bond offering this year, underwr...
lead_paragraph: Municipal bond investors stole center stage in bond trading yesterday as they quickly bought up $1.6 billion of tax-exempt bonds backed by toll revenue from a Southern California highway. In the largest tax-free bond offering this year, underwriters led by Salomon Smith Barney handled the sale by the Foothill/Eastern Transportation Agency and had good demand from institutional buyers, including mutual funds.
abstract: Municipal bond investors buy up $1.6 billion of tax-exempt bonds backed by toll revenue from Southern California highway; Treasury securities are little changed; yield on benchmark 30-year bond is unchanged at 5.91 percent, while price falls 1/32, to 90 25/32; graph on tax-exempt yields; chart on US key interest rates (M)

headline.main: Investors Buy $1.6 Billion Of Municipal Debt Issues
